item.description: I’m a development and environmental economist with a PhD from the Department of Agricultural and Resource Economics at the University of California, Berkeley. My research explores how households in low- and middle-income countries adapt to climate change, manage financial risk, and support women’s economic participation. I’ve led projects on digital information services, climate resilience, and gender-inclusive approaches, as well as financial intermediation and credit access, producing evidence that informs both academic debates and real-world policy decisions.
